metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28493 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
This affects the package jinja2 from 0.0.0 and before 2.11.3. The ReDoS vulnerability is mainly due to the `_punctuation_re regex` operator and its use of multiple wildcards. The last wildcard is the most exploitable as it searches for trailing punctuation. This issue can be mitigated by Markdown to format user content instead of the urlize filter, or by implementing request timeouts and limiting process memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-jinja2 - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
python3-jinja2 - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jinja2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
